snippet: Many residents of Gaza City said they were tired of the bombings by Israel and the cycle of war, but were steadfast in support of an end to economic restrictions by Egypt and Israel.
abstract: Residents of Gaza Strip are expressing ambivalence over failed cease-fire with Israel, brokered by Egypt; many say they long for a deal that will change life in Gaza, but doubt Egypt's proposal will do that; ambivalence may help explain why beleaguered Hamas continues firing rockets even after Israeli officials declared that such action will justify further escalation.
lead_paragraph: Many residents of Gaza City said they were tired of the bombings by Israel and the cycle of war, but were steadfast in support of an end to economic restrictions by Egypt and Israel.

headline.main: Gazans, Desiring Deep Change, Are Ambivalent on Egypt Cease-Fire Plan
headline.print_headline: Gazans, Wanting Deep Change, Are Ambivalent on Egypt’s Truce Plan
